learning_objectives.description: Describe the difference between system and application software; provide examples.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: System software: services for computer (OS, utilities). Application software: services for user.

learning_objectives.description: Describe the role and functions of an operating system.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Includes file management, interrupt handling, interface provision, peripheral/driver/memory management, multitasking, application platform, security, user account management.

learning_objectives.description: Understand how hardware, firmware, and operating system are required to run application software.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Apps run on the OS; OS runs on firmware; firmware (bootloader) runs on hardware.

learning_objectives.description: Describe the role and operation of interrupts.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Covers generation and handling via interrupt service routine. Examples: division by zero, memory access conflict (software); key press, mouse movement (hardware).
